page.title: 03LAW AND ORDER 3
page.content:
{juvenile room.}The male cells are very plain. They have a toilet and a single window. The window has three inch glass in it which is reinforced with concrete criss-cross bars.
There is a hard bed, a light in the wall and there is a 'call' button if the prisoner wants anything.The police force in Towcester have a supply of mattresses. This is because the beds are hard and wooden like in the juvenile room. The people who are put in the cells are not allowed belts, shoe laces and other similar things because they can scratch on the walls or hang themselves. The Magistrates in Towcester cannot handle very serious cases, so these go the Northampton court.
